noun.description: Gas, smoke, or vapor that smells strongly or is dangerous to inhale.
examples: clouds of exhaust fumes spewed by cars

verb.description: Feel, show, or express great anger.
examples: "We simply cannot have this," she fumed
the minister reportedly fumed at officials of the department
fragments of lava hit the ground, fuming and sizzling

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French fumer (verb), from Latin fumare to smoke.
